elements.content: The lens of the eye is the clear part of the eye that helps to focus light or an image on the retina.  Light will pass through the lens to the retina where the light is changed into nerve signals that are sent to the brain.  The lens must be clear for the retina to receive a sharp image.  When the lens becomes clouded, the eye is unable to properly focus on objects and the image is blurred.  This is known as a cataract.

Cataracts occur as a result of structural changes to protein fibers within the lens.  Normally, the lens will slowly change from clear to a yellow/brown, adding a brown tint to vision.  This is a gradual change starting with a slight cloudiness that could eventually affect the identification of colors; mostly blues and purples.  The softness and transparency of the eye lens is lost, making the eye lens become hard and dry.  As time passes, there is an opaque cloud that will increase till it covers the complete eye lens.

Cataracts usually develop in both eyes; but generally, one eye is more severely affected.  Cataracts are one of the leading causes of blindness for millions of Americans over the age of 40.  More than 12 million Americans suffer from cataracts.

content.content: Secondary cataracts can form as a result of other health problems like Hyperparathyroidism, Down’s Syndrome, atopic dermatitis, diabetes, hypoglycemia, high blood sugar levels, and low calcium levels.
Traumatic cataracts can develop after an eye injury, developing years later.

Congenital cataracts occur if the mother had rubella during the first three months of pregnancy or if the infant has the inability to properly digest lactose.  These cataracts generally do not get worse.

Toxic buildup.  Examples:  Hair dye has been scientifically shown to cause cataracts.  Studies show that 89% of those who dye their hair develop cataracts.  Other studies reveal that people who smoke, take steroids, have heavy metal poisoning, low immune system (stress, allergies, and so forth), or who eat seafood (ingesting mercury) are more likely to develop cataracts.
